sections.content: Initial platform design only supported monthly subscriptions, but user research revealed different patient preferences: some wanted annual plans for savings, others needed quarterly for cash flow. We needed billing flexibility to support diverse go-to-market strategies.
Through stakeholder interviews and patient research, identified key requirements:

content: Annual memberships for price-conscious patients ($499/year vs. $49/month)
Quarterly options for mid-range commitment
Multi-brand support with different billing strategies per brand
Flexible membership benefits tied to subscription type
Easy subscription modification for patients

sections.title: Business Requirement
sections.content: Support multiple subscription models from day one to enable diverse go-to-market strategies across multi-tenant platform. Each brand should be able to configure its own billing options.

content: Flexible subscription cycle support (30-365 days)
HIPAA compliance and BAA availability
API quality and webhook reliability
Healthcare-specific features
Pricing structure for healthcare SaaS

sections.content: Selected PayTheory for superior subscription flexibility and healthcare focus.

I designed a flexible subscription architecture that supports n-day billing cycles, not just monthly/annual. I wrote the specific retry logic specification for failed payments (dunning management), defining exactly how many times to retry and at what intervals before cancelling the subscription.

sections.title: Architecture Components
content: Subscription Plans: Configurable billing cycles at brand level
Membership Benefits: Per-plan benefit configuration (e.g., annual members get extra consultation credits)
Payment Methods: Credit card storage with PCI compliance
Billing Engine: Automated charging, retry logic, dunning management
Webhooks: Real-time payment status updates
Admin Tools: Subscription management, refunds, adjustments

sections.content: Wrote detailed integration specs for PayTheory implementation:

content: Subscription creation with custom billing cycles
Subscription modification (upgrade/downgrade/pause)
Cancellation with prorated refunds
Payment retry logic for failed charges
Webhook handling for payment events
Admin interface for subscription management

sections.content: Variant-based subscription architecture enables flexible billing. Prescribers select between product variants‚Äîeach representing different dosage strengths and price points. PayTheory's billing engine supports different pricing for each variant, enabling tiered subscription models that align with clinical needs.

content: Backend: PayTheory API integration with 8 endpoints
Database: Subscription models with flexible cycle support
Frontend: Subscription selection UI with clear pricing
Admin: Brand-level billing configuration
Webhooks: Real-time payment status processing
Error handling: Payment failures, retry logic, customer notifications

sections.content: Business requirements demanded pricing override capabilities for comp subscriptions, discounted trials, and uninsured patient support. This interface shows how admins override pricing while maintaining HIPAA-compliant audit trails. All price overrides require mandatory justification and are logged for compliance.

content: Subscription creation for monthly, quarterly, annual plans
Payment success and failure scenarios
Retry logic and dunning workflows
Subscription modifications and cancellations
Prorated refunds and adjustments
Multi-brand configuration testing

sections.content: Launched with multiple subscription options from day one:

content: Hedfirst: $499/year AI Care Membership as primary model
Alternative: $49/month for lower commitment
Future brands: Flexibility to test different pricing strategies
A/B testing capability for pricing optimization

sections.content: Interactive Demo: Webhook Integration & Audit Trail

HIPAA compliance requires comprehensive audit trails for all billing events. PayTheory webhooks feed real-time payment data into this patient history timeline, creating transparency for patients, providers, and compliance auditors. Every subscription creation, payment attempt, and status change is logged with timestamp and actor information.

sections.content: Building flexibility from the start enables business model experimentation. By designing for 30-365 day billing cycles upfront, we avoided costly refactoring later. The membership benefits configuration system became critical for differentiating subscription tiers beyond just price. Technical architecture decisions have direct business impact‚Äîthis integration enabled Hedfirst's entire revenue model.
